intro: Senecio polypodioides, commonly known as the lace fern or silver fern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance. Senecio polypodioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and low maintenance requirements.
